title: Accessibility Strategies for Designing Inclusive Online Learning Environments (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Experience Using Digital Devices and Ability to Access Online Learning Platforms
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens with diverse physical and cognitive conditions, operating in mobile environments where consumption of fragmented learning content is feasible

learning_goals: Learners can independently navigate content using accessibility tools (text enlargement, voice conversion, etc.) in mobile environments
Learners can evaluate microlearning content that applies inclusive design principles (alt-text provision, colorblind-friendly design)
Learners can design online activities (providing text/audio/video options) that reflect diverse learner needs
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
